decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - 1.	The proposed building would, by reason of its size, shape, design and position, close to the back edge of the pavement in Stanley Road, be out of character with, and unduly obtrusive to, the street scene and local visual amenity, contrary to policies ENV-B.1.1 (New Development) and H.4.1 (Housing Standards and Guidelines) of the London Borough of Hounslow's adopted Unitary Development Plan (2003) as amended, and associated Supplementary Planning Guidance (February 1997) 'General Standards and Controls' 1 "Design and Layout", and 'Residential Standards and Controls' 9 "Form and Design", and 10 "Private Amenity Space", together with Policy 4B.1 (Design principles for a compact city) of the London Plan Consolidated with Alterations since 2004 (2008). 

2.	The proposal represents an unacceptable overdevelopment of the site providing units with poor aspect, outlook, sense of privacy and safety and security to the Stanley Road frontage, and with inadequate amenity space, contrary to policies ENV-B.1.1 (New Development), ENV-B.1.9 (Safety and Security) and H.4.1 (Housing Standards and Guidelines) of the London Borough of Hounslow's adopted Unitary Development Plan (2003) as amended, and associated Supplementary Planning Guidance (February 1997) 'General Standards and Controls' 1 "Design and Layout", and 'Residential Standards and Controls' 10 "Private Amenity Space", together with Policies 4B.1 (Design principles for a compact city) and 3A.6 (Quality of new housing provision) of the London Plan Consolidated with Alterations since 2004 (2008). 

3.	The proposed development makes no provision for off-street parking at a location where it is considered that car free parking is inappropriate and where additional on-street car parking will arise on local roads not within a Controlled Parking Zone, which will have a harmful impact on the safety and free flow of traffic on the adjoining highway network, contrary to policies ENV-B.1.1 (New Development), T.1.4 (Car and Cycle
